storyclubthemes about

Ever wanted to write a story about a man who loses his head and meets a giant seagull? Or maybe the one where the man who fits sails to his car is more up your street.

Got a tale to tell? Is there a story inside you just bursting to get out? Welcome to Story Club - you have found your people.

Make creative writing a regular habit. The Story Club community writes and shares bite sized reads every week.

How it works

  • Check out the latest challenge on the Story Club website
  • Write your 500 word story and submit it within the week
  • Read everyone else’s work and FEEDBACK - it’s all about helping each other improve.
  • Write, rinse repeat

Be part of a growing and completely non-influential community.

Recent feedback

lewis•2019-02-21T16:48:53 on A warm welcome

In-laws hey! I was expecting a bit more of a twist for this one. But it was well written and characters were quite honest. I was jus hoping for something extra at the end.

hannah•2019-01-27T20:50:28 on A warm welcome

Love the dynamic here it feels very real. The characters are well developed given the brevity. James’ Mum particularly from the first twitch of the curtain up to the victorious smirk!

hannah•2019-01-17T12:58:54 on Best before

Oh I loved this! They remind me of the couple who ran the post office on Crwys road (now an artisan micro-beer pub). The guardian of the curly ended sandwich line was inspired. Liz?
